intro: Zeuxine leucotaenia, commonly known as the white-stemmed zeuxine, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are small and white, with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Zeuxine leucotaenia is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
